properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 15 at 3:10PM CST until January 16 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Des Moines IA
properties.description:
...Cold Tonight, Winter Storm Arrives Friday...

.Falling temperatures tonight and blustery northwest winds will
lead to bitter cold wind chills of -20 to -25 tonight into
Thursday morning across north central Iowa. Snowfall returns to
Friday morning as a winter storm takes aim on the region. The snow
may be heavy at times during the morning and afternoon hours
before eventually transitioning into a period of light wintry mix
or freezing rain. Strong northwest winds develop Saturday which
could lead to areas of blowing snow, in addition to lingering
light snowfall Saturday morning. Highest snowfall accumulations
nearing 6 inches will reside in north central Iowa with lesser
amounts of 3 to 4 inches further south.

* WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills
expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. For the Winter
Storm Watch, total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches and ice
accumulations of around one tenth of an inch possible. Winds
could gust as high as 50 mph Saturday and create areas of
blowing snow.

* WHERE...North central Iowa.

* WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 9 PM this evening to 9
AM CST Thursday. For the Winter Storm Watch, snow begins Friday
morning and may be heavy at times into the afternoon hours.
Snowfall then changes over to light wintry mix or freezing rain
Friday evening. Additional light snowfall possible late Friday
night into early Saturday.

* IMPACTS...The cold wind chills tonight could cause frostbite on
exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. Plan on slippery road
conditions developing Friday, which could impact the morning and
evening commutes. Areas of blowing snow could significantly
reduce visibility Friday into Saturday.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM CST THURSDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON
